answers.answer: It sounds like you are having side-effects to the Flagyl.  I would call your OB or go to an Urgent Care Center and see if they can switch you to a different medication.

All the symptoms you described are the same as the ones I had when I had hyperthyroidism.  This is probably just a coincidence that the symptoms are so similar.  Nonetheless, sometimes thyroids do wierd things during pregnancy.

definitely sounds like you need a follow up appt real soon. have you ever been tested for diabetes? if the symtoms get better with sugar that sounds like a possibility. and if you are having shortness of breath and rash or hives it may be a reaction to the flagyl. best to go get checked out.....
It does sound like it could be the early stages of hyperthyroidism.  Have your doctor do a TSH, Free T4, and Free T3 blood test.  Also, the headaches are normal during this part of your pregnancy.

Sounds like a blood sugar issue, which I also have. The OB nurse just said to make sure I carry fruit snacks. I had an incident last week, in my 16th week and once I drank a glass of kool aid I felt okay again.

I am so feeling jsut like you I'm almost 15 weeks and its actually my sugar dropping.  SI make sure I have some cheese crackers or something to bring it up..  I eat smaller meals and that helps too...  just more often...

question: Hi.  I am 15 weeks pregnant and experiencing strange symptoms.  My morning (all day) sickness seems to be getting better, but now some other things are going on.  I was diagnosed with bacterial vaginosis and am taking flagyl now for it.  I have been experiencing shortness of breath, racing heart, shakiness, nervousness, headache, irritability, a need to lay down, and a craving for sugar.  Sometimes, I will take a sip of dr pepper and that helps for a short while.  I have not experienced this before with other pregnancies.  Does anyone have any idea what this could be?  Do you think it is related to the medicine?  I almost feel bad enough to go to the ER...I just really feel like something is wrong.  Any advice would be appreciated!  Thank you.
title: 15 weeks and strange symptoms
